hw1

Class Traveler

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw1.Traveler

  • public class Traveler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a traveler that can visit cities.
    Author:
    Harrison Helgevold

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SYMPATHY_FACTOR
      An instance variable that stores the fixed value for the calculation of how much money a traveler can get if they call home.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Traveler(int initialFunds, City initialCity)
      A constructor that constructs a traveler with a specified amount of money and starting city.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void callHomeForMoney()
      A method in which the traveler calls home for money.
      java.lang.String getCurrentCity()
      A method that returns the name of the current city the traveler is in.
      int getCurrentFunds()
      A method that returns the amount of money the traveler has remaining.
      java.lang.String getJournal()
      A method that returns the journal of the traveler.
      int getTotalNightsInTrainStation()
      A method that returns the number of nights the traveler has spent in a train station.
      boolean isSOL()
      A method that calculates whether or not the traveler is SOL.
      void sendPostcardsHome(int howMany)
      A method that sends a specified number of postcards home.
      void visit(City c, int numNights)
      A method that moves the traveler to a new city, and updates the instance variables "currentCity", "journal", "moneyLeft", and "costToSendPostcard".

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • SYMPATHY_FACTOR

        public static final int SYMPATHY_FACTOR
        An instance variable that stores the fixed value for the calculation of how much money a traveler can get if they call home.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Traveler

        public Traveler(int initialFunds,
                City initialCity)
        A constructor that constructs a traveler with a specified amount of money and starting city. Additionally the value of each instance variable is calculated.
        Parameters:
        initialFunds - How much money the traveler starts with.
        initialCity - The city in which the traveler starts.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentCity

        public java.lang.String getCurrentCity()
        A method that returns the name of the current city the traveler is in.
        Returns:
        The name of the city the traveler is in.

      • getCurrentFunds

        public int getCurrentFunds()
        A method that returns the amount of money the traveler has remaining.
        Returns:
        The amount of money the traveler has remaining.

      • getJournal

        public java.lang.String getJournal()
        A method that returns the journal of the traveler.
        Returns:
        The traveler's journal.

      • isSOL

        public boolean isSOL()
        A method that calculates whether or not the traveler is SOL.
        Returns:
        "true" if the traveler is SOL and "false" if the traveler is not SOL.

      • getTotalNightsInTrainStation

        public int getTotalNightsInTrainStation()
        A method that returns the number of nights the traveler has spent in a train station.
        Returns:
        The number of nights the traveler has spent in a train station.

      • visit

        public void visit(City c,
                  int numNights)
        A method that moves the traveler to a new city, and updates the instance variables "currentCity", "journal", "moneyLeft", and "costToSendPostcard". Additionally, the method calculates how many nights the traveler will have to spend in a train station.
        Parameters:
        c - The city the traveler wants to visit.
        numNights - The number of nights the traveler wants to stay in the city.

      • sendPostcardsHome

        public void sendPostcardsHome(int howMany)
        A method that sends a specified number of postcards home. If the cost to send the specified number of postcards exceeds the amount of money the traveler has remaining; the max number of postcards will be sent that leave the traveler with at least zero dollars.
        Parameters:
        howMany - The number of postcards the traveler wants to send home.

      • callHomeForMoney

        public void callHomeForMoney()
        A method in which the traveler calls home for money. The amount of money the traveler receives is equal to the fixed "SYMPATHY_FACTOR" instance variable multiplied by the "postcardsSent" instance variable. After calling home the instance variable "postcardsSent"'s value is reset back to 0.
